metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27216 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 has Execution with Unnecessary Privileges. By leveraging a delete_pid_file race condition, a local user can delete arbitrary files as root. This involves the -oP and -oPX options.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27216` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.93-13ubuntu1.5
exim4-base - 4.93-13ubuntu1.5
exim4-config - 4.93-13ubuntu1.5
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.93-13ubuntu1.5
exim4-daemon-light - 4.93-13ubuntu1.5
eximon4 - 4.93-13ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.93-13ubuntu1.5').
